Text: Enron Japan power marketing position I printed this put it in your mtg folder mm Steve Mark Please find attached a draft QA on our power marketing position in Japan I thought you might find it useful background in case you meet with John Sherriff while he is over in Houston this week I understand that John is now minded NOT to make an internal announcement about the proposed changes However we will need to make changes to the EJ website and to the standard media pack Let me know if I can help with anything else Jackie

Accomplishments Cc Ive printed this out put in the folder w the others mm Happy New Year to you and your family Steve I hope you got something of a break despite all the brushfires Please find attached the achievements that you asked for The only thing I didnt put down is that I had a whole lot of fun doing all these things Please let me know if you need any further details Best wishes Jackie

Letter to counterpartiesPlease find attached a copy of the letter that has been prepared for commercial teams who wish to write to counterparties about the merger The content was discussed and agreed by Lance Schuler and Mark Evans and of course by John Sherriff Thanks

Letter to employees in Enron EuropeJohn Sherriff and Michael Brown would like to send out the attached letter to employees in Europe this afternoon ie in the next hours I would be grateful if you would review it and let us have your approval as soon as possible I have a couple of questions in relation to the content Can we refer to Wessex Water on our list of noncore assets in Europe Can we list the specific businesses under review as per the proposed draft below which is not included in the attached draft The businesses currently under review in Europe are Global Markets except Coal Industrial Markets Metals Credit and the Wind Turbine manufacturing business Also under review is the E Power generation asset development business in Japan Given that these businesses are being identified in the media I would assume that we can although note that they dont appear in your message point summary received last night A prompt response would be very much appreciated Thanks Jackie

European Media Cc I understand from Ann that you are looking put some subscriptions in place for European publications to help you keep abreast of whats going on over here Im preparing a full list of all the Englishspeaking trade journals for your perusal but in the meantime I thought Id make a few suggestion of how we can help you with this task In my view some of the most accurate and insightful coverage comes from the FT Energy special publications unit They cover the whole of Europe through a number of different titles Enron Europe has an online group subscription to this series so I am arranging for you to receive a password so you can access this site Most of the publications come out twice a month My group is responsible for media monitoring in Europe The material comes from a variety of sources and it is quite a challenge to process and distribute it effectively I suggest that we put you on the distribution list for all material that either specifically mentions Enron or that relates to regulatory matters in Europe We have a number of different PR companies working for us in our markets around Europe and they generally provide media monitoring as well but this is not normally translated into English unless there is something significant I suggest that we include you in the circulation for those pieces We also cover Japan Australia and the Middle East from here Japan I guess Nick ODay will send material to you direct We have a daily translation service of headlines and significant longer pieces from our PR agency in Tokyo Australia I will send you what we get but things are fairly quiet there at present I know that Mark Schroeder was in dialogue with Paul Quilkey about the status of Government Affairs but I dont believe the issue was resolved I would like to talk to you separately about this issue at some point if you have a minute Middle East I am still trying to get on the circulation list for media coverage as we effect the transition from John Amblers group I plan to talk to John about this when he surfaces from handling DPC issues next week In my experience the key publication for this area is MEED the Middle East Energy Digest I will send you a full list of Englishspeaking trades and highlight the ones which I think you will find most useful I believe quite a few of them are now available online Please let me know if I can help with anything else and perhaps we can get together for lunch on your next visit Jackie
